contentrichtext.text: {{Notability|date=November 2010}} '''Dick Stoken''' is an [[USA|American]] businessman and [[author]]. A 1958 [[M.B.A.]] graduate of the [[University of Chicago]]'s [[University of Chicago Booth School of Business|business school]], Stoken has been a member of the [[Chicago Mercantile Exchange]] since 1959 and the [[Chicago Board of Trade]] since 1971.<ref>[http://books.global-investor.com/pages/gurus.htm?PerIndex=1891 Global Investor Bookshop]</ref> Stoken is also a founding partner in broker [[Lind-Waldock]] and is head of Strategic Capital Management, a [[commodity trading advisor]] firm that manages commodity pools and [[hedge fund]]s.<ref>[http://www.traders.com/Documentation/FEEDbk_docs/Archive/1298/Abstracts_new/Stoken/Stoken9812.html Technical Analysis of Stocks & Commodities Magazine]</ref> ==Bibliography== * ''Cycles'' (1978) * ''Strategic Investment Timing'' (1984) * ''The Great Cycle'' (1993) * ''The Great Game of Politics'' (2004) * '"Survival of The Fittest for Investors" (2011) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Cite journal | last=Krautkramer | first=Wayne | title=You're Trapped in a Box Canyon Stupid! | journal=Safe Haven | date=July 29, 2004 | url=http://www.safehaven.com/article-1805.htm }} *[http://strategic-inv.com/strategic/dstoken.htm Dick Stoken's profile on Strategic Investments] {{Authority control|VIAF=93313848}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> |name= Stoken, Dick |alternative names= |short description= American writer |date of birth= |place of birth= |date of death= |place of death= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stoken, Dick}} [[Category:American non-fiction writers]] [[Category:University of Chicago Booth School of Business alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] {{US-business-bio-stub}}
